subNodes.conversationText: root

approached the hole in the floor. It was too dark to see where it went. Something smelled like it was rotting down there -- something made of flesh.

This seemed to interest Pharaoh. He jumped from â€™s shoulder to perch by the hole, peering over the edge like a child peering into a well.
[Wisdom] Perhaps there was a clue about what was down there nearby. <He/She> looked around.
[Success] Sure enough, <he/she> saw blood smeared on the floor.
[Wisdom] <FirstName> examined the blood more closely.
[Success] Some of the debris on the shack's floor -- pebbles, leaves, dust -- had been pushed over the blood as if to conceal it from casual observation.
[Continue.]
This made <him/her> more curious.
<FirstName> got on <his/her> hands and knees to get a better look into the hole.
Maybe <he/she> could find a way down.

Nothing looked safe. There was no ladder and no wall down which to clamber: the hole opened into space. If <he/she>'d had a hook and rope, <he/she> might have found a way down, but <he/she> doubted that anything in the shack -- including the floor -- was sound enough for such an attachment.
Not curious enough, however, to investigate further.
[Failure] <He/She> saw nothing significant.
<He/She> looked for a way into the hole.

Nothing looked safe. There was no ladder and no wall down which to clamber: the hole opened into space. If <he/she>'d had a hook and rope, <he/she> might have found a way down, but <he/she> doubted that anything in the shack -- including the floor -- was sound enough for such an attachment.
Perhaps leaving the shack was a better idea than staying.
[Failure] <He/She> saw nothing significant.
<FirstName> got on <his/her> hands and knees to get a better look into the hole.
Still, <FirstName> was curious enough to look for a way down.

Nothing looked safe. There was no ladder and no wall down which to clamber: the hole opened into space. If <he/she>'d had a hook and rope, <he/she> might have found a way down, but <he/she> doubted that anything in the shack -- including the floor -- was sound enough for such an attachment.
No doubt some animal had fallen in. The young witch left the hole alone.
<FirstName> got on <his/her> hands and knees to get a better look into the hole.

"Anyone home? We're taking a census." said an unwelcome voice.

Four members of the Congress of Moths came in. One held a quill and a ledger. was paralyzed by surprise.
[Continue.]
"Are you living, dead, or moribund?"
[Continue.]
"Mark this one down as moribund. Scratch that. Dead!"
[Continue.]
The redcap lunged at <FirstName>, but Knott grabbed the creature by her nape before she could push <FirstName> into the hole. Pharaoh jeered.
[Continue.]
"Hmm." The serious-looking fairy was writing. "'Young witch with bum in air.' Not dead yet -- I'll mark <him/her> as moribund. Hmm." The fairy glanced down the hole. "One dead down there."
[Continue.]

"A young witch came upon a hole
And in <he/she> went, and out her soul --
If souls there were, but souls there ain't.
A body is enough to taint."
[Continue.]
<FirstName> readied <him/her>self for battle.
[End.]
[Skip Combat.]
Are you sure?
[Yes.]
[No.]
